item.title: Water for Pakistan: Lifeline, Dependency, and the Shifting Control
item.description: Water is not just a natural resource for Pakistan—it is its lifeline. With over 90% of its water supply coming from a single river system, Pakistan is critically dependent on external sources. Agriculture, power generation, and daily life across the country rely on uninterrupted water flow, primarily from rivers originating in Indian-administered territory.
